title: so far as it relates to regulations 3 and 5) and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Exempted
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Exempted 

Traveller) (Covid-19) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 26th day of March
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited health act 1947 (exempted traveller) (covid-19) regulation 2021 (2) regulation shall come operation 26th day march

title: so far as it relates to regulations 3 and 5) and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the
so far as it relates to regulations 3 and 5) and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

“Act of 1947” means the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947); 

“relevant person” has the meaning assigned to it by Regulation 3; 

“relevant test result” means, in relation to a transit passenger, a record or 
evidence, in written or electronic form, confirming that – 

(a) 

(b) 

the person has been subject to a RT-PCR test, 

such test was administered to the person no more than 72 hours 
before he or she arrives in the State, and 

(c) Covid-19, or the virus SARS-CoV-2, was not detected in the 

person at the time of taking the test; 

“RT-PCR test” means a reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction test, the 
purpose of which is to detect the presence of Covid-19, or the virus SARS-CoV2, in the person to whom it is administered; 

“transit passenger” means a person prescribed under Regulation 4. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th March, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [134] 3

title: so far as it relates to regulations 3 and 5) and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the
heading: 3. The following persons (each of whom, in these Regulations, is referred
text_raw:
3. The following persons (each of whom, in these Regulations, is referred 
to as a “relevant person”) are specified as relevant persons for the purposes of 
these Regulations: 

(a) 

authorised officers; 

(b) medical officers of health; 

(c) 

officers of the Minister for Justice, being immigration officers 
appointed by that Minister under section 3 of the Immigration Act 
2004 (No. 1 of 2004); 

(d) officers of customs (within the meaning of the Customs Act 2015 

(No. 18 of 2015)); 

(e) 

any officer, employee or agent of the Health Service Executive 
who is acting in the course of his or her duty as such officer, 
employee or agent.

title: so far as it relates to regulations 3 and 5) and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the
heading: 4. For the purposes of paragraph (j) of the definition of “exempted traveller”
text_raw:
4. For the purposes of paragraph (j) of the definition of “exempted traveller” 
in section 38B(25) of the Act of 1947, a person is prescribed as an exempted 
traveller where the person – 

(a) 

arrives at a port or airport in the State for the purposes of 
travelling to another state, 

(b) does not leave the port or airport concerned before so travelling, 

(c) 

has a relevant test result, if he or she is more than 7 years of age, 

(d) presents himself or herself to a relevant person or a member of 
the Garda Síochána on arrival at a port or airport in the State, and 

(e) 

complies with any request of a relevant person or a member of the 
Garda Síochána under Regulation 5.

title: so far as it relates to regulations 3 and 5) and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the
heading: 5. A relevant person or a member of the Garda Síochána may request a
text_raw:
5. A relevant person or a member of the Garda Síochána may request a 

transit passenger: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

to provide such information or documentation as may be required 
in order to verify that the transit passenger has arrived in the State 
for the purposes of travelling to another state; 

to remain at the place where he or she presents himself or herself 
to the relevant person or a member of the Garda Síochána, or at 
such other place in the port or airport as he or she may be 
requested to remain by the relevant person or a member of the 
Garda Síochána; 

to go to such place in the port or airport as requested by the 
relevant person or a member of the Garda Síochána or to 
accompany the relevant person or a member of the Garda 
Síochána to such a place. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [134] 

GIVEN the Official Seal of the Minister for Health, 

25 March, 2021. 

FERGAL GOODMAN, 

A person authorised under section 15 of the Ministers and 
Secretaries Act 1924 to authenticate the seal of the Minister 
for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [134] 5

title: so far as it relates to regulations 3 and 5) and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These regulations define transit passengers as exempted travellers for the 
purposes of section 38B (25) (inserted by section 7 of the Health (Amendment) 
Act 2021) of the Health Act 1947, as amended. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [134]
